rules.natural: If authorities ordered evacuation in Region A, then public safety was ensured in Region A
Either authorities ordered evacuation in Region A or authorities ordered evacuation in Region B
If the governor requested federal aid, then the federal agency issued a disaster declaration
Either the governor requested federal aid or the governor activated state resources
If the governor activated state resources, then whenever disaster assessment was completed for Region A, emergency response would be initiated in Region A
If the federal agency issued a disaster declaration, then the federal agency activated national response
If the federal agency activated national response, then under the condition that disaster assessment was completed for Region A, emergency response would be initiated in Region A
If an emergency plan exists for Region A, then should public safety not be ensured in Region A, evacuation chaos would not occur in Region A
If evacuation was completed in Region A, then public safety was ensured in Region A
If evacuation was completed in Region B, then evacuation was completed in Region A
If the emergency center issued conflicting directives, then coordinated response was achieved among agencies
Either the emergency center issued conflicting directives or evacuation was completed in Region B

If the emergency center consulted a crisis management expert, then should it not be the case that conflicting directives from the emergency center lead to no coordinated response among agencies, then communication breakdown would occur among emergency teams
Either evacuation was extended for Region A or the emergency center did not issue conflicting directives
If all clear was issued for Region A, then evacuation was not extended for Region A
Either all clear was issued for Region A or partial reentry was authorized for Region A
If partial reentry was authorized for Region A, then full reentry was authorized for Region A
If environmental all clear was issued for Region A, then whenever full reentry was authorized for Region A, evacuation would not be extended for Region A
If the sensor network monitoring system was activated, then groundwater contamination was detected
Either the sensor network monitoring system was activated or the chemical spill containment did not fail
If the industrial plant underwent emergency shutdown, then groundwater contamination was not detected
Either the industrial plant underwent emergency shutdown or the backup containment system was activated
If the backup containment system was activated, then groundwater contamination was not detected
If emergency response was initiated in Region A, then public safety was ensured in Region A
If emergency response was initiated in Region B, then emergency response was initiated in Region A
Either emergency response was initiated in Region B or disaster assessment was completed for Region A
If authorities ordering evacuation in Region B does not lead to public safety being ensured in Region A, then the chemical spill containment failed
If public safety was not ensured in Region A, then evacuation chaos occurred in Region A

facts.natural: An emergency plan exists for Region A
The emergency center consulted a crisis management expert
Environmental all clear was issued for Region A
Communication breakdown did not occur among emergency teams

target.natural: Public safety was ensured in Region A

The emergency center did not issue conflicting directives
Evacuation was completed in Region B
Evacuation was completed in Region A

Evacuation was not extended for Region A
